title: How to Make Quilted Coasters

steps.headline: Obtain the needed supplies listed below under "Things You'll Need".
Trace the shape of the coaster or potholder onto the quilted material.
Cut the shape out.
steps.description: You will now have a quilted shape with raw edges.

steps.headline: Cut a length of triple fold bias tape the length of the edge plus an inch.
Place the bias tape over the raw cut edge of the coaster.
Pin it carefully into place, smoothing as you go to avoid wrinkles.
Sew the tape in place, either by hand or by machine.

text: Obtain the needed supplies listed below under "Things You'll Need".  Trace the shape of the coaster or potholder onto the quilted material.  Cut the shape out. You will now have a quilted shape with raw edges. Measure the edge.  Cut a length of triple fold bias tape the length of the edge plus an inch.  Place the bias tape over the raw cut edge of the coaster.  Pin it carefully into place, smoothing as you go to avoid wrinkles.  Sew the tape in place, either by hand or by machine.  Remove the pins and use!
